subject: AI & Agents
title: Versioning Your Prompts Like Code
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Versioning Your Prompts Like Code.

hook.text: Production broke because someone changed the system prompt and didn't tell anyone.

buildup.text: Prompts drift like codeâ€”small edits accumulate, and nobody tracks what changed.

discovery.text: Store prompts in version control. Tag each version. Deploy like a code release.

twist.text: Pair each prompt version with its eval scores so you know which version is best.

climax.text: Use a prompt registry: name, version, eval score, deployment status, owner.

punchline.text: If it's not versioned, it's not production.

quiz.question: Why should prompts be versioned?
options: To track changes and link to eval scores
